description: A comprehensive look at the history, culture, and politics of the Mekong River region.

locations.description: Cambodia's capital, a major city on the Mekong.
Former royal capital of Laos, situated on the Mekong.
Largest city in the Mekong Delta region of Vietnam.
Thai town on the Mekong, bordering Laos.

title: The Mekong: Turbulent Past, Uncertain Future
author: Milton Osborne

description: A novel about a man's search for a missing friend in India, blending mystery and reflections on identity and displacement.

locations.description: The story unfolds across various locations in India, with this coordinate representing a central point in the country.

title: Indian Nocturne
author: Antonio Tabucchi

description: A satirical novel about a young Russian billionaire, set against the backdrop of the chaos and corruption of post-Soviet states.

locations.description: The novel spans various locations in post-Soviet countries, highlighting the cultural and political landscape of the region.

title: Absurdistan
author: Gary Shteyngart

description: Stevenson's account of his travels through the Cévennes mountains of southern France, blending nature writing and personal reflection.

locations.description: The Cévennes mountain range in southern France, where Stevenson embarked on his journey with a donkey, experiencing the local landscape and culture.

title: Travels with a Donkey in the Cévennes
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

description: Strayed's memoir of her solo hike along the Pacific Crest Trail, a journey of personal transformation and healing.

locations.description: The Pacific Crest Trail stretches from Mexico to Canada through California, Oregon, and Washington, serving as the backdrop for Strayed's transformative journey.

title: Wild: From Lost to Found on the Pacific Crest Trail
author: Cheryl Strayed

description: Steinbeck's account of his road trip across America in search of the essence of the nation and its people.

locations.description: The book covers a cross-country journey across the United States, exploring various regions and their unique characteristics.

title: Travels with Charley: In Search of America
author: John Steinbeck

description: A novel about the decline of a once-famous American novelist, set against the backdrop of Hollywood and the East Coast literary scene.

locations.description: One of the main settings, representing the glamour and pitfalls of the film industry.
Representing the East Coast literary scene in the novel.

title: The Disenchanted
author: Budd Schulberg

description: Seth's account of his hitchhiking journey through the remote regions of western China, offering insights into the local cultures and landscapes.

locations.description: The western Chinese region where Seth's journey begins.
The final destination of Seth's journey, known for its unique culture and landscape.

title: From Heaven Lake: Travels Through Sinkiang and Tibet
author: Vikram Seth

description: A travelogue of Syme's journey through the Middle East, exploring the region's history, culture, and religious significance.

locations.description: The book covers various locations across the Middle East, with this coordinate representing a central point in the region.

title: The Road to Mecca
author: Ronald Syme

description: Terzani's account of his year-long journey through Asia by land and sea, avoiding air travel.

locations.description: Starting point of Terzani's journey.
Capital of Laos, visited during his travels.
One of the major cities Terzani explores in Vietnam.
Capital of Cambodia, another stop on Terzani's journey.

title: A Fortune-Teller Told Me: Earthbound Travels in the Far East
author: Tiziano Terzani

description: A travelogue of Lewis's journeys through Vietnam in the 1950s, during the French Indochina War.

locations.description: Capital of Vietnam, a major focus of Lewis's observations.
Important port city visited by Lewis.
Former imperial capital of Vietnam.
Then-capital of South Vietnam, another key location in the book.

title: Vietnam: A Dragon Apparent
author: Norman Lewis

description: Shackleton's firsthand narrative of his ill-fated expedition to Antarctica, detailing the incredible story of survival and heroism.

locations.description: The primary setting of Shackleton's expedition, where the crew faced extreme challenges in the frozen landscape.

title: South: The Story of Shackleton's Last Expedition 1914–1917
author: Ernest Shackleton

description: Rushdie's personal and political exploration of Nicaragua during the Sandinista revolution, blending travelogue and reportage.

locations.description: The book covers various locations across Nicaragua during the Sandinista period.

title: The Jaguar Smile: A Nicaraguan Journey
author: Salman Rushdie

description: An account of the 1866-1868 French expedition to explore the Mekong River.

locations.description: Starting point of the French Mekong Expedition.
Important stop on the expedition's journey.
Capital of Laos, visited during the expedition.
City in Yunnan province, China, near the expedition's northernmost point.

title: Mad about the Mekong: Exploration and Empire in South-East Asia
author: John Keay

description: Tashi's memoir of her life with a Bedouin tribe in Jordan, offering insights into their culture and traditions.

locations.description: Petra, the ancient city in southern Jordan, serves as the primary setting for Tashi's experiences with the Bedouin tribe.

title: Married to a Bedouin
author: Tashi Tenzing

description: Swift's classic satirical novel about the travels of Lemuel Gulliver to fantastical lands, providing commentary on human nature and society.

locations.description: The book features multiple imaginary lands, each representing different aspects of human society and behavior.

title: Gulliver's Travels
author: Jonathan Swift

description: A journey through Vietnam's history and culture through the lens of its ceramic art.

locations.description: Capital city, home to many important ceramic collections.
Famous pottery village near Hanoi.
Former imperial capital, significant for its historical ceramics.
Ancient town known for its pottery and ceramic traditions.

title: The Elephant and the Lotus: Vietnamese Ceramics in the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
author: John Stevenson

description: Raban's account of his journey down the Mississippi River, exploring the river's history, ecology, and the people living along its banks.

locations.description: The main setting of the book, spanning multiple states along its course.

title: Old Glory: A Voyage Down the Mississippi
author: Jonathan Raban
